comment: Found in Austin. Drink neat, very smooth. But with any ice nuanced flavor is lost.
Warm. Notes of cinnamon and vanilla. Creamy and dreamy.
The best a delight to drink
very rich. really like the lack of corn sweetness.
My first taste from Margaux at side car PDX 2012
Favorite bourbon of mine... Hard to find and retails in my area (Atlanta)for $50. If you see it don't buy it... Call me first.
One of the most solid bourbons around. If you can find it, drink it!
Had at the Minaco in Alexandria
Cherry is what comes across to me with this.

Served this bourbon for years before I had an understanding of exactly how good it is. The now make their whiskey a in Oregan not Kentucky, but this edition is the last made while in Kentucky.  A must own if ever find again!!
Not as rounded body as blantons but pretty much the same.
Über smooth!  Maple notes but not too sweet.
My all time favorite bourbon that I've owned. Bought it last year when you would see a bottle here or there, but for the last year has been impossible to find.
Had it tonight at Heim BBQ in Fort Worth! Great whiskey and for the price amazing!
One of my All time favorites. The bourbon that got my Fiance into drinking whisky straight.
love this.  an old staple of mine but a bit tough to find these days.
As one might expect, this delicious bourbon is reminiscent of maple syrup. Smooth as silk and simply yummy!

Sweet aroma with hints of honey and caramel. Tad bit of spice. On the palate not as sweet as the smell. Mild caramel remains but sweetness replaced with rye spice and a mild oak flavor. Mild spice on the finish. Good sipper.
Meh.  Hype train juice.  Nothing great.
Sweetness from the maple coats your tastes throughout each sip!  Delicious!! 12/16/18 Sample

These are unprecedented times for all of us... It's been 3 weeks of quarenteen and straddling teleconferences with being a part time teacher to my daughters... We should not forget the overnight devistating impact the virus had on our local restaurants and watering holes... For our part the Arizona Whiskey Community has made every effort to promote and support our local businesses buying meals and  and to go Whiskey as often as possible.. After percuring another delivery of Bourbon from one of our local restaurants one of the owners included a sample of this beauty from his personal collection... Let's dive in...

It enters fairly viscous for the proof.... Vanilla and honey dipped cherries lead with oak lingering in the background..milk chocolate and clove hit on the mid palate... The finish is lengthy with vanilla and wood spice... Hint of tobacco... It's just such a lovely Bourbon..

I really enjoyed this Whiskey... For the $40 price when it was released it was a steal .... Nowadays it's way overpriced ... If you can get a pour or sample, definitely do it.... Finally Support Local Please!! National chains will survive but your local shops, bars and restaurants may not...

Cheers All!
Really good. Biggest thing to note... sweet tea!
Paid $30 for a pour in Louisville, not worth that price, but loved the well rounded complexity.
